intro: Chamaerhodos altaica, commonly known as the Altai fireweed, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking red or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Chamaerhodos altaica is noted for its resilience to harsh climatic conditions and is often found in high-altitude ecosystems.
